headline: Norwegian Cruise Line (NCLH) Is Up 7.2% After Record Oceania Sonata Bookings And New Flagship Reveal
summary: Norwegian Cruise Line Holdings recently highlighted record-breaking launch-day bookings for its luxury brand Oceania Cruises’ upcoming ship, Oceania Sonata, while also unveiling plans for its newest and largest vessel, Norwegian Aura, expected to begin sailing in May next year. Together, these developments point to firm demand for premium itineraries and suggest that Norwegian’s expanding fleet mix could matter more for investors than headline capacity alone. Next, we’ll examine how record...

headline: Oceania Cruises® Celebrates Keel Laying for New-Generation Ship, Oceania Sonata™, at the Fincantieri Shipyard in Marghera, Italy
summary: Oceania Cruises®, the world's leading culinary- and destination-focused luxury cruise line, has celebrated a pivotal milestone in the construction of its next-generation ship, Oceania Sonata™, as the keel of the ship was laid at the Fincantieri shipyard in Marghera, Italy. The ceremony, an important maritime tradition, honored the rich heritage of shipbuilding, the importance of partnership, and underscored the line's bold vision of its future.

raw.headline: Oceania Cruises® Celebrates Keel Laying for New-Generation Ship, Oceania Sonata™, at the Fincantieri Shipyard in Marghera, Italy

The ceremony, an important maritime tradition, honored the rich heritage of shipbuilding, the importance of partnership, and underscored the line's bold vision of its future.

headline: BofA Reworks Credit Cards to Fuel Ambitious Consumer Profit Plan
summary: Reworking the rewards program is one lever the firm is pulling in its effort to lift the annual profit of the consumer unit to $20 billion by the end of the decade, a feat that’s been achieved only twice in the history of the US banking industry.  As part of the broader consumer push, executives said in interviews that they’re deploying millions of dollars and using artificial intelligence in a bid to lure new customers and persuade existing ones to do more business with the bank.  “The focus is on growth,” said Holly O’Neill, 54, head of Bank of America’s consumer business.

headline: This Investment Pro Recommends Checking Into Hyatt Hotels, Out of Airbnb
summary: C. Patrick Scholes, a managing director at Truist Securities, also likes the prospects for Norwegian Cruise Line and Choice Hotels.
